section.name: More about variation (optional)
section.page: The square of the standard deviation is called the variance; its value is harder to understand but it is the basis of important advanced statistical methods. The degrees of freedom are the number of pieces of information contributing to the standard deviation (or variance).
The root mean squared error summarises how close the values in a data set are to a target, k.
The standard deviation is similar to the root mean squared error, but summarises distances to the mean of the data. Its value can be interpreted in terms of the average area of squares on a graph.
